blocks.text: On the next page you will find information on a hypothetical study.

This information is presented in the form of an informed consent document. It outlines the purpose of the study, what participation involves, any potential risks and benefits, and your rights as a participant.
Please read this information carefully.
Ãœberschrfit
(Waiting)
Dear pre-service teachers,

Thank you very much for your willingness to take part in this study. We are particularly interested in your professional development during your preparation period. In the following, we would therefore like to find out from you how you experience your preparatory service, as well as your current professional convictions, your professional well-being and your knowledge of topics from different areas of educational science.

The survey is expected to take 90 minutes. The information you provide will be used to examine the reform processes of the preparatory service in more detail. You will not suffer any disadvantages as a result. All reports on the results of the evaluation will be based on summarized data. It is therefore not possible to draw conclusions about individual persons - and this is not the intention of the study management, as the relevant questions of the evaluation project do not relate to individual persons.

The responsibility for collecting and processing the data lies with the head of the evaluation project, Prof. Dr. Erika Musterfrau. If you have any questions about the survey, please contact the test management on site.
We greatly appreciate your commitment in participating in this survey and would like to thank you for your conscientious cooperation.
Yours sincerely
Prof. Dr. Erika Musterfrau
Information on voluntary participation and data protection:

Participation in the survey is voluntary. You will not suffer any disadvantages if you do not take part in the survey. If you do not wish to answer individual questions, you can omit them from the processing.
Information on the handling of personal data

The Musterforschungsinstitut works in accordance with the provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG), the Hessian Data Protection and Freedom of Information Act (HDSIG) and all other data protection regulations.
The following data is collected as part of this survey
1. questionnaire data on your personal assessments regarding your professional and personal well-being, as well as processes during your preparatory service
2. recording the educational knowledge acquired during your studies
3. recording your technological and pedagogical knowledge.
4. socio-demographic data: This data about you, such as age and gender, is collected and processed exclusively for scientific purposes, i.e. to answer research questions.

5. individual code: As the survey is part of a longitudinal study, you will generate an individual code consisting of a multi-digit combination of letters and numbers at the beginning of each survey. This code is used to link the data of one and the same person from different survey dates. In addition, this code is used to subsequently identify your data in the event of a revocation (see below).
We would like to use this data as described below:

Your data will be stored securely and only authorized researchers will have access. These researchers and employees involved in the project who have access to the data are obliged in writing to comply with data protection regulations.

The publication of research results in publications or at conferences takes place exclusively in anonymized form and at no time allows conclusions to be drawn about you as a person. No personal data will be published. The results are presented exclusively in anonymized form. This means that no one can recognize from the results which person provided the information. Parts of your statements may be quoted, e.g. in publications, reports, on the web or in other presentations of results. This is done in anonymized form, i.e. without giving your name or address.

Subject to your consent, the data collected in this survey will be stored in a trustworthy archive in accordance with good scientific practice and used by other scientists for educational research purposes. Subject to your consent, the data will be transferred to a professional research data center after completion of this study in accordance with the guidelines of the German Research Foundation on good scientific practice. This center will ensure that the data is stored securely and protected against unauthorized access. In the data center, the data is available to other authorized researchers for scientific purposes in thematically related research areas for defined research purposes. Your data will always be treated confidentially in compliance with data protection laws.
You can assert the following data protection rights at any time:
Article 7(3) GDPR: Right to withdraw consent
You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time with effect for the future.
Article 15 GDPR: Right to information
You have the right to obtain information from us about which of your personal data we process.
Article 16 GDPR: Right to rectification
If the data concerning you is incorrect or incomplete, you can request the correction of incorrect data or the completion of incomplete data.
Article 17 GDPR: Right to erasure
You can request the erasure of your data at any time.
Article 18 GDPR: Right to restriction of processing
You may request the restriction of the processing of your personal data.
Article 21 GDPR: Right to object
You can object to the processing of your personal data at any time.
Article 77 GDPR: Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

If you are of the opinion that we have not complied with data protection regulations when processing your data, you can lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority, which will examine your complaint.

The individual code generated by you at the beginning of the questionnaire will be removed in the course of processing the data before it is transferred to a professional research data center.  Once the data has been transferred (probably at the end of 2025), we will no longer be able to delete the data provided there in the event of a revocation. The data protection regulations of the research data center apply.
In any case, your participation in our survey is voluntary. If you refuse to participate or revoke or restrict your consent, you will not suffer any disadvantages as a result.
A declaration to assert your rights must always be sent in writing to the data controller.

Would you sign the informed consent for this study?
What is the main reason why you would not sign the consent?
Is there a scenario in which you could imagine not signing the consent form?
This information may be of interest to you with regard to the points you mentioned.
Please carefully review this information.
Taking into account the information on the previous page:
Would you sign the informed consent of this study?
